title: The One With the Lesbian Wedding

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok. Here's his diaper bag, and his uh, Mr. Winky, and uh...oh, him. Hi!

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: So how did everything go?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, great. Great. There was a projectile, uh, throwing up incident, but he started it.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Well, we've gotta go.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: [clears her throat]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Oh, right. Um, I've got some news. It's about us.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, you and me?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Uh, no, Susan and me.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: The other us.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: We're uh, we're getting married.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: As in, "I now pronounce you wife and wife" married?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Anyway, we'd like you to come, but we totally understand if you don't want to.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Why wouldn't I want to come? I had fun at the first wedding.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Look I just thought that...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No no no, I mean, hey, why shouldn't I be happy for you? What would it say about me if I couldn't revel in your joy? I'm revelling baby, believe me!

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Is your finger caught in that chair?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mmm hmmm.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Want us to go?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh-huh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: This is so cool. You're actually gonna be on television.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It really hit me last night. I'm gonna be on Days of our Lives. And then I started thinkin' about all of u, and how these are the days of our lives..

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yes! Carol and Susan's caterer had a mountain bike accident this weekend, and she's in a full body cast.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yes!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: They want me to do it, which is really cool, seeing as I've never catered before, and I really need the money, and this isn't a problem for you, is it?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Would it matter?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, you are so great! [kisses him] Thank you!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Are you really not going?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I am really not going. I don't get it. They already live together, why do they need to get married?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: They love each other, and they wanna celebrate that love with the people that are close with them.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: If you wanna call that a reason.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: [singing to the tune of Mister Rogers' Neighborhood] Who's the bitterest man in the living room, the bitterest man in the living room? Hi, neighbor.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ross, I thought you were over this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, that has nothing to do with this, ok? She's my ex-wife. If she were marrying a guy, none of you'd expect me to be there.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, if she were marrying a guy, she'd be like the worst lesbian ever.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: [entering hurriedly] Did I miss it? Did I miss it?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, I'm on right after this guy shoots himself.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Whoa, she's pretty.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, and she's really nice too. She taught me all about how to work the cameras, and smell-the-fart acting.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It's like, you got so many lines to learn so fast, that sometimes you need a minute to remember your next one. So while you're thinkin' of it, you take this big pause where you look all intense, you know, like this.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, ok.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: There's my scene, there's my scene. [Joey on tv] "Mrs. Wallace, I'm Dr. Drake Ramoray, your sister's neurosurgeon.

dialogue.speaker: MRS. WALLACE
dialogue.text: Is she gonna be all right?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm afraid the situation is much worse than we expected. Your sister is suffering from a..subcranial hematoma. Perhaps we can discuss this over coffee.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nice!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: That's great!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Excellent!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: For a minute there I thought you were actually tryin' to smell something.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: That is so good! Do it again!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, all right. "Damnit Braverman, it's right there on the chart!"

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's great. All right, I gotta get to work, I got a big dinosaur bone to inspect.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No no, that's me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, hello.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, thanks. I couldn't uh...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Is everything ok?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, no, huh-uh. One of my clients died on the massage table today.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my god.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's a little more relaxed than you want them to get.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, um, she was 82 years old. Her name was um, Mrs. Adelman.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, honey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, it's just so strange. I mean, she probably woke up today and thought, "ok, I'll have some breakfast, and then I'll take a little walk, and then I'll have my massage." Little did she know God was thinking, "Ok, but that's it." Oh, but the weirdest thing was, ok, I was cleansing her aura when she died, and when the spirit left her body, I don't think it went very far.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I think it went into me.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: God, this is so hard. I can't decide between lamb or duck.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, of course, lambs are scarier. Otherwise the movie would've been called Silence of the Ducks.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ok, who ordered what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, I believe I had the half-drunk cappuccino with the lipstick on the rim.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, and this with the cigarette butt in it, is that decaf?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh god.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I can't believe you're so uptight about your mom comin'.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know, but it's just it's the first time, and I just don't want her to think that because I didn't marry Barry, that my life is total crap, you know?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: [Mrs. Adelman's voice] Talk about crap. Try listening to Stella Niedman tell the story of her and Rod Steiger for the hundredth time.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, Pheebs, how long do you think this lady'll be with us?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don't know. I mean, she obviously has some kind of unfinished business. [Mrs. Adelman's voice] Sit up!

dialogue.speaker: MRS. GREEN
dialogue.text: [entering] There she is.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mom!

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: Sweetie! So this is where you work? Oh, it's wonderful! Is it a living room? Is it a restaurant? Who can tell? But I guess that's the fun.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pretty much.

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: Monica! You look gorgeous! Last time I saw you, it was eat or be eaten.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: This is Joey, and Phoebe, and this is Chandler, and you remember Ross.

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: Oh hello, Ross.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi, Mrs. Green. [He gets up to shake her hand, but she ignores him.]

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: So, what do you think of my daughter in the apron with the big job?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh Mom!

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: If you didn't pour the coffee, no one would have anything to drink.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Believe me, sometimes that happens.

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: This is just so exciting. You know, I never worked. I went straight from my father's house to the sorority house to my husband's house. I am just so proud of you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: Yes.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know who it is you remind me of. Evelyn Dermer. 'Course, that's before she got the lousy face lift. Now she looks like Soupy Sales.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Pheebs, who's Evelyn Dermer?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don't know. Who's Soupy Sales?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: Oh my god, there's an unattractive nude man playing the cello.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah, well just be glad he's not playing a smaller instrument.

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: [laughing] You have some life here, sweetie.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I know. And Mom, I realize you and Daddy were upset when I didn't marry Barry and get the big house in the suburbs with all the security and everything, but this is just so much better for me, you know?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: I do. You didn't love Barry. And I've never seen you this happy. I look at you and I think, oh, this is what I want.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: For...me.

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: Well, not just for you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, what do you mean?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: I'm uh, considering leaving your father.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: [entering] All right. Tell me if this is too cute. Lesbian wedding, chicken breasts.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh god. I think I'm gonna be sick.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why? It's not like I'm putting little nipples on them.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And you had no idea they weren't getting along?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: None.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: They didn't fight a lot?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No! They didn't even talk to each other. God, how was I supposed to know they were having problems?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: [Mrs. Adelman's voice] In my day, divorce was not an option.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, look who's up.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I just can't believe this is happening. I mean, when I was little, everybody's parents were getting divorced. I just figured as a grownup I wouldn't have to worry about this.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Is there any chance that you can look at this as flattering? I mean, she's doing it because she wants to be more like you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, then, you know, couldn't she have just copied my haircut?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You know, it's funny when my parents got divorced, they sent me to this shrink, and she told me that all kids have a tendency to blame themselves. But in your case it's actually kinda true.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That's him.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Damn. My mail order grandfather hasn't come yet.

dialogue.speaker: MR A
dialogue.text: Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes, hi, Mr. Adelman. Thanks for meeting me.

dialogue.speaker: MR A
dialogue.text: Oh, that's all right, although you did cut into my busy day of sitting.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, do you wanna sit?

dialogue.speaker: MR A
dialogue.text: Oh, no, please, I spent most of mid-morning trying to stand up. Now uh, what can I do for you, my dear?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I don't know how to say this, but I think when your wife's spirit left her body, it um, kind of stuck around in me.

dialogue.speaker: MR A
dialogue.text: You're saying, my wife is in you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. Ok, you don't have to believe me but um, can you think of any unfinished business she might have had, like any reason she'd be hanging around?

dialogue.speaker: MR A
dialogue.text: Well, I don't know what to tell you dear. The only thing I can think of is that she always used to say that before she died, she wanted to see everything.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Everything?

dialogue.speaker: MR A
dialogue.text: Everything.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Whoa, that's a lot of stuff.

dialogue.speaker: MR A
dialogue.text: Oh, wait, I remember, she also said she wanted to sleep with me one last time.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, there's laughing in my head.

dialogue.speaker: MR A
dialogue.text: [to Joey] Worth a shot, huh?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: Look at this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: These are from Halloween three years ago.

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: Oh, look, here's Barry. Did he have to come straight from the office?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: No, that was his costume. See, he's actually an orthodontist, but he came as a regular dentist.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Um, you guys, you know when I said before, "thank you, but I don't really need your help"?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Actually, what I think you said was, "don't touch that, and get the hell out of my kitchen."

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really? Weird. Anyway, see, I planned everything really well. I planned and I planned and I planned. It just turns out, I don't think I planned enough time to actually do it.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, Mon, you want some help?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: If you want.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: [enters] Hey. What a day. I took her everywhere. The Museum of Modern Art, Rockefeller Center, Statue of Liberty.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: She's still with you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah. I guess she hasn't seen everything yet. I'll be right back, she has to go to the bathroom again. [Takes Mrs. Green's chin in her hand and says, in Mrs. Adelman's voice] Oh, such a pretty face.

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: This is so much fun, just the girls. You know what we should do? Does anybody have any marijuana?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: God!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, look, nobody's smoking pot around all this food.

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: That's fine. I never did it. I just thought I might. So, what's new in sex?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh! What's new in sex?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: The only man I've ever been with is your father.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm dicing, I'm dicing, I don't hear anything.

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: I mean, this is no offense to your dad, sweetie, but I was thinking there might be more.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sorry. You know what? I cannot have this conversation with you. I mean, god, you just come in here, and drop this bomb on me, before you even tell Daddy. What? What do you want? Do you want my blessing?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: You want me to talk you out of it?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Then what? What do you want?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: I guess I just figured of all people you would understand this.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Why on earth would I understand this?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: You didn't marry your Barry. I did.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right people, we're in trouble here. We've only got 12 hours and 36 minutes left. Move, move, move!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Monica, I feel like you should have German subtitles.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, speed it up!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, it's the pigs. they're reluctant to get in the blankets!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Monica, how did this happen? I thought you had this all planned out.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Do you want me to cry? Is that what you want? Do you wanna see me cry?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Sir! No sir!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: [to Ross] All right, you!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No. Look, I told you I am not a part of this thing.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, look, Ross. I realize that you have issues with Carol and Susan, and I feel for you, I do. But if you don't help me cook, I'm gonna take a bunch of those little hot dogs, and I'm gonna create a new appetizer called "pigs in Ross". All right, ball the melon.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey! How come I'm stuck dicing, when he gets to ball the melon.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: How's it going?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It's goin' great. Right on schedule. Got my little happy helpers. [everyone groans]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Fine, whatever.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What's the matter?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Nothing. Ok, everything. I think we're calling off the wedding.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You're still gonna pay me, right? Or something a little less selfish.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Carol, what's the matter? What happened?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: My parents called this afternoon to say they weren't coming.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my god.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: I mean, I knew they were having trouble with this whole thing, but they're my parents. They're supposed to give me away and everything.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's ok. I'm sorry.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: And then Susan and I got in this big fight because I said maybe we should call off the wedding, and she said we weren't doing it for them, we were doing it for us, and if I couldn't see that, then maybe we should call off the wedding. I don't know what to do.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I uh can't believe I'm gonna say this, but I think Susan's right.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: You do?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, do you love her? And you don't have to be too emphatic about this.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Of course I do.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well then that's it. And if George and Adelaide can't accept that, then the hell with them. Look, if my parents didn't want me to marry you, no way that would have stopped me. Look, this is your wedding. Do it.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: You're right. Of course you're right.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So we're back on?

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: We're back on.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You heard the woman. Peel, chop, devil! I can't believe I lost 2 minutes.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It just seems so futile, you know ? All these women, and nothing. I feel like Superman without my powers, you know? I have the cape, and yet I cannot fly.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well now you understand how I feel every single day, ok? The world is my lesbian wedding.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: [Mrs. Adelman's voice] Butterscotch? No one? All right, you'll be sorry later.

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Any time. [He doesn't want to let her go]

dialogue.speaker: CAROL
dialogue.text: Ross. [He lets her go]

dialogue.speaker: MINISTER
dialogue.text: You know, nothing makes God happier than when two people, any two people, come together in love. Friends, family, we're gathered here today to join Carol and Susan in holy matrimony.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: [Mrs. Adelman's voice] Oh my god. Now I've seen everything! [Phoebe's voice] Whoa, she's gone. She's gone. She's gone! Go ahead, get married. Go, go.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Would you look at them?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, can't help but.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: [to a wedding guest] How's that pig-in-the-blanket workin' out for you? [the guy nods] I wrapped those bad boys.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I miss Rose.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: I know it's kind of weird, but I mean, she was a big part of my life there, you know, and now I just feel kind of alone.

dialogue.speaker: WOMAN
dialogue.text: You know, I uh, I couldn't help but overhear what you just said, and I think it's time for you to forget about Rose, move on with your life...how 'bout we go get you a drink?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ok, that's so nice.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: [to an attractive woman] I shouldn't even bother coming up with a line, right? [The woman walks away]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, Mom? Having fun?

dialogue.speaker: MRS GREEN
dialogue.text: Oh, am I! I just danced with a wonderfully large woman. And three other girls made eyes at me over the buffet. Oh, I'm not saying it's something I wanna pursue, but it's nice to know I have options.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: There's more alcohol, right?

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: How you doin'?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: You did a good thing today.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: You wanna dance?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, that's fine.

dialogue.speaker: SUSAN
dialogue.text: Come on. I'll let you lead.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Ok.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: [to the woman who just rejected him] All right look. Penis schmenis. We're all people. [She walks away again.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Ok, which one of us do you think is gonna be the first one to get married?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, Mon, I was married.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, me, too, technically.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I had a wedding.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: All right, just trying to start an interesting discussion.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I got one. Which one of us do you think will be the last to get married? [They all look at Chandler]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Isn't Ben in this?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah!

events.event_description: Ross hands Carol her son's diaper bag, Mr. Winky, and greets him.
Carol informs Ross that she and Susan are getting married.
Ross expresses happiness and support for Carol and Susan's wedding.
Monica discusses her new catering job for Carol and Susanâ€™s mountain bike accident.
Joey prepares for his role on 'Days of Our Lives' and explains acting techniques to Chandler.
Phoebe shares with Ross that a client died during her massage session.
Rachel arrives hurriedly, asking if she missed the wedding, and Joey responds humorously.
Mrs. Green visits Rachel at her workplace and comments on her daughter's job and appearance.
Mrs. Green reveals her intention to leave Rachel's father and expresses pride in Rachel's happiness.
